meanings.definition: Showing or requiring great attention to detail
meanings.sent1: She is very finicky about the way her clothes are folded.
meanings.sent2: The artist was finicky about the colors he used in his painting.
meanings.sent3: The finicky cat refused to eat unless its food was arranged just right.
meanings.sent4: Her finicky taste in music made it challenging to find a concert she would enjoy.
meanings.sent5: The finicky inspector meticulously checked every corner of the room for clues.

meanings.sent1: The finicky eater refused to try any new foods.
meanings.sent2: The finicky customer complained about every little detail of the meal.
meanings.sent3: His finicky behavior at the restaurant annoyed his friends.
meanings.sent4: The finicky toddler only wanted to wear one specific pair of shoes.
meanings.sent5: Being finicky about his workspace, he rearranged his desk multiple times a day.

meanings.sent1: The finicky flower wilted quickly in the hot sun.
meanings.sent2: The finicky baby would cry at the slightest noise.
meanings.sent3: The finicky computer required gentle handling to avoid malfunctions.
meanings.sent4: Her finicky mood could change with the smallest inconvenience.
meanings.sent5: The finicky old clock would stop ticking if it was moved even slightly.
